feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...TRACE ASHFALL POSSIBLE ACROSS UNIMAK, AKUTAN, AND UNALASKA ISLANDS... As of 2300Z or 3:00 PM AKDT Tuesday afternoon, satellite imagery detected an ongoing plume of ash from the recent eruption of Shishaldin. This ash plume is drifting southwest just south of Unimak, Akutan, and Unalaska Islands. As winds turn more southerly
entry.cap:areaDesc: Alaska Peninsula; Eastern Aleutians

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 2:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Thursday into Saturday Morning... Elevated surf is expected to develop along the coast near the Yukon Delta and St Lawrence Island. North to northeasterly winds will increase Thursday morning to 30 to 45 mph with gusts to 60 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for north facing coastal areas of St Lawrence Island and the Yukon Delta. Winds
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 03 at 9:42PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... The Florida Department of Environmental Protection has issued an Air Quality Alert due to elevated levels of Particulate Matter of 2.5 micrometers or less, until 7 AM CDT Wednesday. Members of sensitive groups may experience adverse health effects. The general public is not likely to be affected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Escambia Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 03 at 9:22PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall over and upstream from Astor combined with northeast winds have brought the Saint Johns River at Astor into Moderate Flood. River levels are forecast to remain in Moderate Flood between 3.0 and 3.1 feet through the weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 3:22AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF FOG EARLY THIS MORNING... Areas of fog developed during the night in eastern Pennsylvania and northern New Jersey. Be sure to leave plenty of room between your vehicle

Tides running 1.5 to 2 feet above predicted astronomical tide levels. * WHERE...In Louisiana, West Cameron, East Cameron and Lower Vermilion Parishes. In Texas, Lower Jefferson County.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Jefferson

entry.title: Freeze Warning issued October 03 at 3:09PM MDT until October 04 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 degrees expected. * WHERE...Sanpete Valley and Southwest Utah. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 9 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Sanpete Valley; Southwest Utah

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Saint John and Saint Thomas. * WHEN...Until 800 AM AST.
